tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: Doctor is friendly and felt his diagnosis was accurate, we went to consult for my daughter who was suffering from fever, headache and stomach pain, she recovered within the time he prescribed, we can trust this doctor and can visit him

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Dr. Chetak is very,  very to the point. Makes parents comfortable, does not suggest any unrequired medicines. I highly recommend him to all. 
Specific Experience 
My newborn had a mild jaundice when he was born. This continued for long and several people suggested me to get medication for him. We consulted Dr. Chetak that time and he brought us into confidence that no medication is required. Worried at the first place since others were constantly pointing to yellow color on my baby's face, But ultimately he became alright in a month or so. In nutshell,  he evaluates the problem carefully and sympathetically. Hope this helps practice readers and followers.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I would start with saying safest hands with lot of care have taken for my kid, born at 26th week with very low weight. After 3 months of treatment, now my baby is recovering in good fashion. He didnt even opt for a leave during this time. He was always available and did explain the treatment happening with detailed examples. We could reach him all the time whenever required. He listens and answers woth patience.

Just imagine that he sent message to us about the followup, when we were delay for a day. That must interest that he shows towards the kids.

 Also he was referring to very good drs for surgerys. All the very best sir, keep doing the great work!!

tags: None
review: Took my child for fever. Doctor rushed through consolation and hardly examined my son. Paid Rs.600 got just 2 minutes of consultation. Prescribed normal medicine for cold and an antibiotic. Finally had to take my son to another doctor as the fever didn't subside even after 3 days of medication.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
My child name is Suhas , i frequently visit Chetak for all vaccinations and other pediatric care.
He saved my son twice and with his provided information (we were not aware when child is born) 1 surgery has been done.
Overall experience is very good , he always guided us for the correct treatment.

tags: None
review: Dr Chetak was very to the point and we felt he gave us very good all rounded advice. Also we felt he does not give unnecessary medicines and we liked the fact that he was very particular about things we should and should not be doing, which we feel  was ultimately good for our child.

tags: None
review: Very good doctor. will not simply recommend antibiotic & unnecessary treatments. Will always available to help out and can get through wattsup & SMS. even if you are out of station he will be happy to help with mobile SMS/Watts up  communication. He will ensure the child gets right treatment at right time.

tags: None
review:
His examination towards the baby is very good. Our gynecologist has reffered him. first we had consulted in Rainbow, they told that the baby is having urinal infection and we need to get admitt immediately for 3 days and told to give the medicines from nerve. we got confused. but once we consult chetak all the confusions got cleared. he suggested the medicines which we can give orally to the baby. Within 2 days we have seen the result.
Thanks Dr.chetak.

Would definitely recommend.

tags: None
review: He was too good....I visited him for the first time. My baby fell down from the cot, he patiently analyzed by baby and said she was completely OK and didn't suggest unnecessary scans...he advised that less than 1 yr baby will have flexible bones and more flesh thus chances of getting fracture is very very less.....and my baby is completely alright after we monitored her for 48 hrs....Apart from this we followed the vaccination chart of 2 yrs old, so he suggested the new one which had few other vaccines for FLU, etc...its an added infrmation for us....Thanks to him- I strongly suggest him and would continue to visit.

tags: Value for money,Wait time,Treatment satisfaction,
review: He prescribed the first set of vaccination worth of 11k. Asked me to get it from hospital pharmacy and sent the nurse behind me to pharmacy. Even before I could check for the charges nurse came and took the vaccines saying you can pay and come, we'll give vaccines. When the  bill generated to my surprise it was of 11k. That was the last time I saw him.
